newsitem.title: JAPAN: Itochu, Stasco win 1997 North West Shelf LPG.
newsitem.headline: Itochu, Stasco win 1997 North West Shelf LPG.

text.p: Australia's North West Shelf Project said on Monday that it had awarded 200,000 tonnes of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) each to Shell International Trading and Shipping Co (Stasco) and Itochu Corp for 1997.
The 1997 cargoes, to be lifted at Withnell Bay, Western Australia, were awarded at $1.00 to $2.75 per tonne below Saudi Arabia's contract prices (CP) on a free-on-board (FOB) basis, traders said.
Itochu is likely to market the cargoes mainly into China, they said.
Last year, the North West Shelf Project awarded 250,000 tonnes each to Japanese trading houses Itochu Corp and Sumitomo Corp at CP minus $7.00 to minus $10.00, traders said.

The North West Shelf Project is a multi-national joint venture owned equally by Woodside Petroleum Ltd, BHP Petroleum Pty Ltd, BP Developments Australia Ltd, Chevron Asiatic Ltd, Japan Australia LNG Pty Ltd and Shell Development Proprietry Ltd.
The LPG cargoes consist 48 percent of propane and 52 percent of butane, a spokesman for the venture said.
